DataElement.preferredName: Gene Genomic Identifier Source Identifier java.lang.String
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position (locus) on a particular chromosome, is capable of reproducing itself exactly at each cell division, and directs the formation of a protein or other product. The gene as a functional unit consists of a discrete segment of a giant DNA molecule containing the purine (adenine and guanine) and pyrimidine (cytosine and thymine) bases in the ordered and correct sequence that encodes a specific functional product (i.e., a protein or RNA molecule).:One or more characters and/or numbers that are used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of genomic sequences, mRNA transcripts, protein products, or other class of entities that occurs throughout the genome._Where something is available or from where it originates.:One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing._Generic value domain for a java datatype that is a class that represents character strings.

Concepts.definition: A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position on a particular chromosome and serves as the template for a product that contributes to a phenotype or a biological function.

One or more characters and/or numbers that are used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of genomic sequences, mRNA transcripts, protein products, or other class of entities that occurs throughout the genome.
